text:
He showed his true self right away, no matter how he felt, so people quickly understood what kind of person he was.

“You can’t go to the landlady, that’s just silly!” he shouted. “If you stay, even though you’re his mother, you’ll drive him crazy, and who knows what will happen! Listen, here’s the plan: Nastasya will stay with him now, and I’ll take you both home. You can’t be out on the streets alone; Petersburg is a dangerous place... But never mind that! I’ll run back here, and in fifteen minutes, I promise, I’ll tell you how he is, whether he’s asleep, and everything. Then, I’ll hurry home—I have a lot of friends there, all drunk—and I’ll get Zossimov, the doctor taking care of him. He’s there too, but he’s not drunk; he never is! I’ll bring him to Rodya, and then to you, so you’ll get two updates in one hour—from the doctor, not just from me! If anything is wrong, I swear I’ll bring you back myself. But if everything is fine, you should go to bed. I’ll stay here in the hallway; he won’t hear me. I’ll tell Zossimov to sleep at the landlady’s, so he’s close by. Which is better for him: you or the doctor? So let’s go home! But you can’t go to the landlady’s; it’s fine for me, but not for you. She wouldn’t let you in because she’s... well, she’s a fool. She’d be jealous of Avdotya Romanovna and you too, just so you know... especially of Avdotya Romanovna.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin insists on taking Raskolnikov's mother and sister home for their safety while promising to check on him and bring back the doctor.
